subject: Re: The goals of CMM (Re: [junit] wanted Junit professionals urgently)
msgSnippet: ... Can we see the list of things you don t like, too? -- J. B. Rainsberger, Diaspar Software Services http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603 Let s
messageBody:
Michael Silverstein wrote:

>
>>From: Curt Sampson [mailto:yahoo_sucks@...]
>>
>>On Tue, 26 Aug 2003, Michael Silverstein wrote:
>>
>>
>>>The good part of ET is that you spend less time coming up
>>
>>with scripts
>>
>>>and automating and more time testing, so you have a greater
>>
>>liklihood
>>
>>>of going down a path you might not otherwise have tested.
>>
>>Actually, I've found that without the scripts I spend less
>>time testing, because doing a test similar to a previous test
>>but with just a couple of things changed isn't just a matter
>>if a quick cut, paste and run.
>
> Personally I'm not a fan of exploratory testing but I like to say at
> least one thing nice about something before listing things I don't like
> about it. For a better defense of ET and discussion of the limitation of
> automation than I could ever provide, you should read some of Cem
> Kaner's articles on http://www.kaner.com/. Note that I don't agree with
> a lot of it.

Can we see the list of things you don't like, too?
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
